research experience.name: Planning with Residents: Linking Simulations to Community Narratives
research experience.summary: Designing civic interfaces that connect environmental simulations of the Manhattan Detention Complex project with residents’ narratives in Chinatown.
highlights: Designed a multilingual platform integrating shadow, transportation, and air-quality simulations to communicate impacts of the proposed Manhattan Detention Complex to local residents.
Embedded a context-aware multilingual voice agent that guides residents through scenario explanations, elicits grounded feedback, and stores structured records for planner review.
Conducting co-design workshops and preparing semantic analyses of participant interviews to examine civic sensemaking and engagement processes.

research experience.name: Human-AI Co-Design for Urban and Educational Systems
research experience.organization: University of Florida, Urban Tech and Design Lab
research experience.summary: Exploring multi-user and multi-agent collaboration in urban co-design platforms and K–12 school selection advisory tools.
highlights: Developed an AI-mediated participatory platform enabling multi-user dialogue and iterative visual revisions to explore collective urban design alternatives.
Constructed spatial data pipelines and an interactive advisory interface that integrates a RAG-based agent for transparent, constraint-aware school selection recommendations.

Investigating how participants collaborate with agents in civic co-design and school advisory settings by analyzing dialogue traces and revision histories to understand sensemaking, trust, and decision support.

research experience.name: Physiological and Psychological Responses to Urban Greenery
research experience.organization: NYU, Center for Urban Science + Progress, Global Public Health; University of Florida; Fordham University
research experience.summary: An immersive experiment using virtual reality and multimodal measurement to study context-specific greenery and its effects on human physiology and psychology.
highlights: Developed a controlled framework combining immersive virtual reality with multimodal biosensing (EEG, EDA) to investigate human responses to urban greenery exposure.
Captured panoramic videos across New York City sites and quantified greenery levels using Green View Index, employing AI-assisted visual control to isolate greenery effects across urban contexts.
Launching controlled VR lab sessions (target n≈80), finalizing standardized GVI-tiered protocols and stimuli sets, and conducting initial analyses to inform health-oriented streetscape design.

research experience.name: Spatial Analysis for Linguistic Landscape of Tianjin’s Former Concession
research experience.organization: Nankai University, School of Foreign Studies
research experience.summary: A spatial and qualitative study on how linguistic landscape changes in Tianjin’s former concession districts relate to residents’ cultural identity.
highlights: Digitized 278 Wudadao linguistic signs, coded type, language, and orientation, and built heat layers for per-language and per-period distributions and cross-site densities.
Designed and analyzed surveys and 16 semi-structured interviews to understand how changes in linguistic landscape shape residents’ cultural identity.

Delivered a public-facing interface that combines map-based browsing with keyword search, filters by state, topic, and year, and exports citations for policymakers comparing state CLT provisions.

Evaluated LLM assistants’ impact on manufacturing by mapping information flows, simulating SOP retrieval, and drafting deployment, escalation, and data-governance guidelines for shop-floor adoption.

Coordinated culture-related activities with logistics, HR, and operations teams as well as colleagues in other countries; incorporated localized feedback into communication materials to reflect workplace context.
